summary: The Douglas DC-8 is a jet airliner made in the United States. It was first designed as a refueling plane for the Air Force but later adapted for commercial use. The DC-8 could seat six people across and was powered by four engines. It had different models, some with more fuel capacity for longer flights. The DC-8 was produced from 1958 to 1972, and many were later updated with quieter engines. While mostly retired from passenger service, some DC-8s still fly as cargo planes.
title: Douglas DC-8
